segments.text: I see the boy reaching for the cookie jar, and it’s making me sad.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s so small and standing on that wobbly stool, and no one is helping him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water on the floor is going to make everything worse if he falls.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The mother is just drying dishes, completely unaware of what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she even cares about the kids’ safety.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for a cookie, not even noticing the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the mother should turn around and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is going to ruin the floor, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how oblivious she is to everything around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being sneaky, and it’s making me feel sorry for them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is just a sad reminder of how easily accidents can happen.
segments.speaker: PAR
